original: khyim bdag rnams /
analyzed: khyim bdag rnams /

original: shin tu mi gtsang bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de'i 'og tu mkhris pa'i gnas su 'gro ste /

original: mkhris pa'i gnas su phyin nas /

analyzed: zhu zhing skyur por 'gyur te /

original: rlung gi gnas su 'gro'o //
analyzed: rlung gi gnas su 'gro'o //

translated: Having been digested and arrived at the place of wind,

original: tshigs ma las ni gcin dang ngan skyugs la sogs te /
analyzed: tshigs ma las ni gcin dang ngan skyugs la sogs te /
translated: From the coarse parts, urine, excrement, and so on,

analyzed: sha las tshil lo // tshil las rus pa'o // rus pa las rkang ngo //
translated: From blood, flesh comes about.🔽From flesh, fat comes about.🔽From fat, bones come about.🔽From bones, marrow comes about.

original: rkang las khu chu'o //
analyzed: rkang las khu chu'o //
translated: From marrow, semen comes about.

original: khu chu las lus 'di lta ste /
analyzed: khu chu las lus 'di lta ste /
translated: From semen, this body comes about.

analyzed: de ltar thog ma dang / tha ma'i rgyu mi gtsang ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, because of the impure cause of the beginning and the end,

analyzed: lus mi gtsang bar byang chub sems dpas bsam par bya'o //
translated: the bodhisattva should contemplate the body as impure.

original: lus la mi gtsang bar lta ba na /
analyzed: lus la mi gtsang bar lta ba na /
translated: When he sees the body as impure,

analyzed: byang chub sems dpas 'di snyam du bsam par bya ste /
translated: the bodhisattva should think as follows:

analyzed: lus zhes bya ba 'di ni rus pa sum brgya drug cus khog pa bslang pa /

analyzed: shing ngan pa'i khyim ltar tshigs sum brgyas sbyar ba /

analyzed: rtsa'i dra ba bzhi brgyas klags pa /

original: rgyus pa bdun brgyas sbrel pa /
analyzed: rgyus pa bdun brgyas sbrel pa /

original: chu ba bcu drug gis brtan pa /
analyzed: chu ba bcu drug gis brtan pa /
translated: It is held together by sixteen large bones.

original: chu ba gnyis kyis khyab par dkris pa /
analyzed: chu ba gnyis kyis khyab par dkris pa /

original: rgyu ma 'dom @345b phyed dang bzhis nang khrol byas pa /
analyzed: rgyu ma 'dom @345b phyed dang bzhis nang khrol byas pa /
translated: It is filled with intestines that are four and a half cubits long.

original: long ka dang / pho ba dang 'brel ba'i gnyer ma rim pa bcu drug tu 'khyil ba /
analyzed: long ka dang / pho ba dang 'brel ba'i gnyer ma rim pa bcu drug tu 'khyil ba /
translated: It is coiled in sixteen layers of folds connected to the stomach and intestines.

original: rtsa phran nyis stong lnga brgyas skar khung byas pa /
analyzed: rtsa phran nyis stong lnga brgyas skar khung byas pa /
translated: It has two thousand five hundred small channels like windows.

original: gshis brgya rtsa bdun gyis snod chag pa ltar shig shig por gyur pa /
analyzed: gshis brgya rtsa bdun gyis snod chag pa ltar shig shig por gyur pa /
translated: It is as fragile as a broken pot with one hundred and seven weak spots.

original: spu'i khung bu byed ba brgya stong phrag brgyad cus rtsva ltar khebs pa /
analyzed: spu'i khung bu byed ba brgya stong phrag brgyad cus rtsva ltar khebs pa /
translated: It is covered like grass with eighty thousand pores.

original: dbang po lnga'i bu ga dgu yod pa /
analyzed: dbang po lnga'i bu ga dgu yod pa /
translated: It has nine orifices of the five sense organs.

original: gnas bdun dang ldan pa mi gtsang bas yongs su gang ba /
analyzed: gnas bdun dang ldan pa mi gtsang bas yongs su gang ba /
translated: It is filled with impurities and has seven bodily constituents.

translated: It has one se of brain, one se of fat, three ses of grease, six ses of phlegm, six ses of bile, and wind that draws in everything. It has one bre of blood and one bre of vomit.

analyzed: de dag thams cad kyis bang ba bar bcad pa ltar so sor yongs su gang ba /

original: pags pa rim pa bdun gyis kun nas bskor ba /
analyzed: pags pa rim pa bdun gyis kun nas bskor ba /
translated: It is surrounded by seven layers of skin.

original: ro bro ba drug gis gso ba /
analyzed: ro bro ba drug gis gso ba /
translated: It is nourished by the six flavors.

original: lus kyi me la ngan skyugs kyi sbyin sreg byed pa /
analyzed: lus kyi me la ngan skyugs kyi sbyin sreg byed pa /
translated: It is a burnt offering of vomit into the fire of the body.

original: rtag tu mthar 'dzag pa /
analyzed: rtag tu mthar 'dzag pa /
translated: It is always dripping.

analyzed: lus kyi yan lag de dag thams cad kyis blta na mi sdug pa dri nga ba /
translated: All of these limbs of the body are ugly and stinking.

original: rnag gi rang bzhin yin na /
analyzed: rnag gi rang bzhin yin na /
translated: They are by nature pus.

original: 'di la su zhig gus par byed de /
analyzed: 'di la su zhig gus par byed de /
translated: Who would respect this?

translated: It is to be grasped by the mind as a mere reflection, because it is needed for an instant, and as a mere chariot, because it carries the load.

analyzed: de la 'di skad ces bya ste /
translated: About this, the following is said:

analyzed: de la su zhig chags shing gus pa byed //

analyzed: byang chub sems dpas lus 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnams kyis ldong par brtag par bya /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' lus 'dod chags kyi dra bas khebs shing srid pa'i dra bar chud par brtag par bya /
translated: Bodhisattvas should contemplate the body as being covered by the net of desire and caught in the net of existence.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpas lus kun nas bu gas yongs su gang bas bu ga'i gnas su brtag par bya /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpas lus nad bzhi brgya rtsa bzhis gtses par brtag par bya / byang chub sems dpas @347a *//

analyzed: lus srin bu'i rigs brgyad khri bzhi stong gi gnas su brtag par bya /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpas lus chos la rmongs pas bems po yin par brtag par bya /
translated: Bodhisattvas should consider the body to be like a dull instrument, because of its ignorance of the Dharma.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpas lus mthar gyis grub cing mtha' mar 'jig pas bum pa lta bur brtag par bya /
translated: Bodhisattvas should consider the body to be like a pot, because it is gradually formed and will eventually be destroyed.

original: byang chub sems dpas lus mya ngan gyis gnon pa mang pos gang bas nyam thag par brtag pa bya /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas lus mya ngan gyis gnon pa mang pos gang bas nyam thag par brtag pa bya /
translated: Bodhisattvas should consider the body to be like a place of distress, because it is filled with many things that cause grief.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpas lus tha mar rga shir 'gyur bas brtan pa med par brtag par bya /
translated: Bodhisattvas should consider the body to be unstable, because in the end it will be subject to old age and death.

original: byang chub sems dpas lus g-yo dang sgyu'i nye bar spyod pa dag gis klags par brtag par bya /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas lus g-yo dang sgyu'i nye bar spyod pa dag gis klags par brtag par bya /
translated: Bodhisattvas should consider the body to be like a fraud, because of its deceitful behavior.

original: byang chub sems dpas lus dgang dka' bas sa'i gting lta bur brtag par bya /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas lus dgang dka' bas sa'i gting lta bur brtag par bya /
translated: Bodhisattvas should consider the body to be like the depths of the earth, because it is difficult to fill.

original: byang chub sems dpas lus dga' ba'i gzugs dang / bde ba'i gzugs la zhen pas me long lta bur brtag par bya /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas lus dga' ba'i gzugs dang / bde ba'i gzugs la zhen pas me long lta bur brtag par bya /
translated: Bodhisattvas should consider the body to be like a mirror, because it is attached to pleasant forms and happy forms.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpas lus 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag gis chog mi shes par brtag par bya /
